author: Special Correspondent
text:
The novel campaign launched by Salem Citizens’ Forum on Thursday. —Photo: Special Arrangement

The Salem Citizens’ Forum on Thursday launched a novel campaign to highlight the importance of removal of encroachments from the water bodies and preventing water from getting polluted.

The Forum members took out a tricycle displaying the photos explaining the serious consequences of the encroachments in water bodies and need for their upkeep and maintenance on the roads surrounding the Collectorate throughout the day.

Piyush Manush, convener of the Forum, who is leading the campaign, said that the State Government made a lot of assurances for the removal of encroachments from the water bodies after the recent floods. Water management is the most essential for the survival, economic prosperity and security of the state. However, the promises have not been implemented.

With Mettur Dam receiving all the sewage from Karnataka and with the citizens of both urban and rural areas dumping the wastes and sewage in water bodies, the crisis has already been blown over and over again.

Despite the huge disaster striking the state, the government has not launched any effective step for proper water management.

The members of the Forum distributed pamphlets containing the details of the encroachments to the passersby, seeking their support.

Mr. Piyush said that the protest campaign will be continued and the tricycle will visit various parts of the city to mobilise people’s support from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day.
title: Remove encroachments from water bodies: awareness campaign begins
